alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 15 at 11:47AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until noon EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1145 AM EDT, Emergency management reported flooding near the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring and Grimes Road is closed at this time. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Caribou and Fort Fairfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Never drive through flooded roads or around closed road barricades. The barricades are there for your safety due to the potential for ice jam releases or continued flooding.
